main event: A bright object was observed in the sky near Andrews Air Force Base in Maryland on September 25, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as orange-red in color and emitting particles that appeared to be glowing green and blue.
The object passed over the control tower at Andrews AFB in 45-60 seconds, descending from the south and heading north.
After the object passed, a bright light was observed on the ground about 1 mile east of the tower. The light appeared to be a solid object that then started to break up.
An unidentified noise accompanied the object, and the light on the ground continued for about 20 minutes.
Investigators concluded that the object in the sky was likely a large meteorite that broke up as it fell, and the light on the ground was identified as an outside barn floodlight.
sighted object: a bright, orange-red object emitting colored particles
